alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 17 at 2:48PM AKDT until October 19 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Northeast Gulf Coast, Northern Inner Channels and Central Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Yakutat, Skagway, Haines, Gustavus, And Juneau. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas and at low-water crossings. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Isolated landslides are possible in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Two bands of heavy rain will track over the watch area resulting in a two day total of 2 to 4 inches, with highest amounts at upper elevations. - If you live near or along quick responding creeks, stay alert and be prepared to take action. - Storm drains should be kept clear of debris as much as possible. - The ongoing rains could swamp boats. Mariners should check their vessels periodically.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: City and Borough of Juneau; Municipality of Skagway
